verses.verse: My son <S%H1121><s%>, attend <S%H7181><s%> <S%H8685><s%> unto my wisdom <S%H2451><s%>, and bow <S%H5186><s%> <S%H8685><s%> thine ear <S%H241><s%> to my understanding <S%H8394><s%>:
That thou mayest regard <S%H8104><s%> <S%H8800><s%> discretion <S%H4209><s%>, and that thy lips <S%H8193><s%> may keep <S%H5341><s%> <S%H8799><s%> knowledge <S%H1847><s%>.

For the lips <S%H8193><s%> of a strange woman <S%H2114><s%> <S%H8801><s%> drop <S%H5197><s%> <S%H8799><s%> as an honeycomb <S%H5317><s%>, and her mouth <S%H2441><s%> is smoother <S%H2509><s%> than oil <S%H8081><s%>:
But her end <S%H319><s%> is bitter <S%H4751><s%> as wormwood <S%H3939><s%>, sharp <S%H2299><s%> as a twoedged <S%H6310><s%> sword <S%H2719><s%>.
Her feet <S%H7272><s%> go down <S%H3381><s%> <S%H8802><s%> to death <S%H4194><s%>; her steps <S%H6806><s%> take hold <S%H8551><s%> <S%H8799><s%> on SH'ol <S%H7585><s%>.

Lest thou shouldest ponder <S%H6424><s%> <S%H8762><s%> the path <S%H734><s%> of life <S%H2416><s%>, her ways <S%H4570><s%> are moveable <S%H5128><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, that thou canst not know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8799><s%> them.
Hear <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8798><s%> me now therefore, O ye children <S%H1121><s%>, and depart <S%H5493><s%> <S%H8799><s%> not from the words <S%H561><s%> of my mouth <S%H6310><s%>.
Remove <S%H7368><s%> thy way <S%H1870><s%> far <S%H7368><s%> <S%H8685><s%> from her, and come not nigh <S%H7126><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the door <S%H6607><s%> of her house <S%H1004><s%>:
Lest thou give <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8799><s%> thine honour <S%H1935><s%> unto others <S%H312><s%>, and thy years <S%H8141><s%> unto the cruel <S%H394><s%>:

Lest strangers <S%H2114><s%> <S%H8801><s%> be filled <S%H7646><s%> <S%H8799><s%> with thy wealth <S%H3581><s%>; and thy labours <S%H6089><s%> be in the house <S%H1004><s%> of a stranger <S%H5237><s%>;
And thou mourn <S%H5098><s%> <S%H8804><s%> at the last <S%H319><s%>, when thy flesh <S%H1320><s%> and thy body <S%H7607><s%> are consumed <S%H3615><s%> <S%H8800><s%>,
And say <S%H559><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, How have I hated <S%H8130><s%> <S%H8804><s%> instruction <S%H4148><s%>, and my heart <S%H3820><s%> despised <S%H5006><s%> <S%H8804><s%> reproof <S%H8433><s%>;

And have not obeyed <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8804><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of my teachers <S%H3384><s%> <S%H8688><s%>, nor inclined <S%H5186><s%> <S%H8689><s%> mine ear <S%H241><s%> to them that instructed <S%H3925><s%> <S%H8764><s%> me!
I was almost <S%H4592><s%> in all evil <S%H7451><s%> in the midst <S%H8432><s%> of the congregation <S%H6951><s%> and assembly <S%H5712><s%>.
Drink <S%H8354><s%> <S%H8798><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> out of thine own cistern <S%H953><s%>, and running waters <S%H5140><s%> <S%H8802><s%> out of <S%H8432><s%> thine own well <S%H875><s%>.
Let thy fountains <S%H4599><s%> be dispersed <S%H6327><s%> <S%H8799><s%> abroad <S%H2351><s%>, and rivers <S%H6388><s%> of waters <S%H4325><s%> in the streets <S%H7339><s%>.
Let them be only thine own, and not strangers <S%H2114><s%> <S%H8801><s%> ' with thee.
Let thy fountain <S%H4726><s%> be blessed <S%H1288><s%> <S%H8803><s%>: and rejoice <S%H8055><s%> <S%H8798><s%> with the wife <S%H802><s%> of thy youth <S%H5271><s%>.

Let her be as the loving <S%H158><s%> hind <S%H365><s%> and pleasant <S%H2580><s%> roe <S%H3280><s%>; let her breasts <S%H1717><s%> satisfy <S%H7301><s%> <S%H8762><s%> thee at all times <S%H6256><s%>; and be thou ravished <S%H7686><s%> <S%H8799><s%> always <S%H8548><s%> with her love <S%H160><s%>.

And why wilt thou, my son <S%H1121><s%>, be ravished <S%H7686><s%> <S%H8799><s%> with a strange woman <S%H2114><s%> <S%H8801><s%>, and embrace <S%H2263><s%> <S%H8762><s%> the bosom <S%H2436><s%> of a stranger <S%H5237><s%> ?
For the ways <S%H1870><s%> of man <S%H376><s%> are before <S%H5227><s%> the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of the YY <S%H3068><s%>, and he pondereth <S%H6424><s%> <S%H8764><s%> all his goings <S%H4570><s%>.

His own iniquities <S%H5771><s%> shall take <S%H3920><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> himself, and he shall be holden <S%H8551><s%> <S%H8735><s%> with the cords <S%H2256><s%> of his sins <S%H2403><s%>.
He shall die <S%H4191><s%> <S%H8799><s%> without instruction <S%H4148><s%>; and in the greatness <S%H7230><s%> of his folly <S%H200><s%> he shall go astray <S%H7686><s%> <S%H8799><s%>.
